Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can illustrate a healthy plant that has been watered, showing vibrant colors and upright posture.
The student can illustrate a wilted or unhealthy plant that has not been watered, with drooping stems and leaves.
The student can include sunlight in their drawing to show the presence of light and its effect on plants.
The student is able to contrast plants with water and those without by depicting noticeable differences in health and appearance.
The student can observe and use patterns, such as using different shades of green to show healthier and less healthy plants.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently include details that represent how plants change over time if they do not receive water (might not show gradual wilting).
The student might occasionally overlook including minor elements like soil conditions, which can also impact plant health.
